features: Time Proven Sound Quality - Powered by our 40mm drivers, the Hesh ANC ensures extremly high quality audio with gnarly bass, a dynamic range as well as exceptional acoustics. AND get a whopping 22 hours battery life with active noise cancelling on.
Noise Cancelling Madness - keep the outside noise outside with the active noise cancellation. Hesh ANC carries a 4 Mic digital active noise cancelling experience that rivals anything out there.
22 Hours Battery - Get a whopping 22 hours of play out of a single charge and if you do run out of juice a 10 minute quicky. charge will get you an aditional 3 hours.
Never lost with Tile - With Tile tech, Skullcandy makes it super easy to track down either headphones and keep your gadgets safe! Download the Tile app and follow the instructions to activate
Includes a bonus Skullcandy charging cable.
Buy with Confidence - 1 year US warranty included.
body.description: Plenty of people drop a lot of coin to flex that they can afford noise-canceling headphones. Hesh ANC is for the rest of us. For those of us more concerned with sharing a great playlist than showing off our status. But don’t think you’re compromising: Hesh ANC delivers a 4-mic, digital active noise canceling experience that rivals anything out there. With included Line USB-C to C cable, you can get charged with universally accepted, ultra high quality, charging cable to get your headphones or other devices back to 100% as soon as possible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice headphones.
reviews.reviewText: Bought for my kid. They are comfortable and sound really good.I didnt realize they have a bass slider on them which is really cool actually. Ive never seen that before.Battery life is great. These are not active noise cancelling, which was fine with me... i dont want my kid to be dead to the world or ignore me when I call...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great headphones at great price
reviews.reviewText: Got these on sale and for the price you can't beat them. They are comfy and sound great. Volume could be louder but still great. Battery lasts forever.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My second pair
reviews.reviewText: I got these to replace my last pair of Skullcandy Hesh Evo headphones, which finally died after several years of almost 24/7 use. I get overwhelmed by noise especially at stores, so I frequently wear them while they're off, just to muffle the noise. I will say they are sound dampening, not fully 100% noise cancelation. Which is perfect for me, if someone is speaking directly to me I can hear them, but I can't hear the screaming child 3 isles down. I will admit I'm not a huge sound nerd, but these are defently the best quality headphones I've owned. That's not saying a ton, but I mainly listen to music and I can understand the lyrics much better than any other headphones I've had. They're also super comfy. My scalp is sensitive to headphone bands pulling and these don't do that at all. The ear cups are also nicely padded, both for comfort and also my ears don't rub against the inside

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Ok when I bought these I got them because they had certain things I wanted such as Bluetooth, battery life, these say they are noise cancelling headphones but idk how that works. I found when I gave it a full charge after I had misplaced these for a month they lasted me for a few more days of heavy use the first few days I used it I spent most of the time downloading music to my phone. I can tell you that they have pretty good sound for the price. There is no equalizer or even a bass button on it, just power on and volume + and volume- and then there is a little o button that I thought was just for answering calls but it does something that I should have mentioned in my first review because then maybe I wouldn’t have came back and wrote another add on to that same review. Because in the month that I misplaced my headphones I threw away the empty box with the instructions in it. So I lost how I was able to pair these to my phone so easy. If you lose the directions or you can’t pair them to your phone the 2nd picture where my finger is pointing at the o button, that’s the button you use to pair your headphones to whatever you want to use them on.I felt so stupid when I threw my instruction book away because it tells you that in the book. It is easy to pair these with your electronics.My complaints are still I wish the buttons were knobs because they are so small an old blind lady like me can barely see them without my glasses. I like that they fit snug with the cold weather they keep my ears warm when I’m walking my dog.These headphones have the capability to be used to answer your phone they have a built in microphone and you just push that little circle button to answer. I’ve never used them to talk because I am a texter but I wished they had these when I was working because as a boss I always needed my phone and it was always ringing and I did have to talk but I’m retired now.So I take back my previous reviews and I would recommend these to people on a bit of a budget looking for headphones that have pretty good sound and a decent battery life. Also it doesn’t take long for them to charge either which is another plus in my book.
